page.title: 19Weather in Emborough
page.content: The climate of the Emborough area is somewhat colder than the surrounding countryside because of its altitude. This is noticeable particularly in early Spring whe there is a retardation of some two to three weeks in the start of growth and blossoming. Precipitation during the winter months falls as snow on many more occasions and this tends to lie for longer periods. There is a high incidence of hill fog occuring with south westerly winds, bringing low cloud and drizzle from the Bristol Channel. Showers and thunderstors which develop in polar maritime airstreams at all times of the year, are less intense of prolonged because they appear to e delected to the SE or NW of the area, by the Mendip plateau.
